peril.views.slick

Class Frame

  • java.lang.Object
    • peril.views.slick.Frame

  • public final class Frame
extends java.lang.Object

    Basic Description

    Holds all the visual elements of the frame of the game. This object also provides operations for retrieving Clickable objects based on a click at a certain Point on screen. Each frame that is rendered the current objects drawn on the frame must be cleared using newFrame(Graphics, GameContainer).

    Conceptual Description

    The frame is broken in to 'planes'. These are Lists of objects that can be drawn without overlapping each other. The reason for doing this is, in a one plane frame, no objects overlap and therefore a click at any Point on the frame can only intercept one object. Based on this any object that overlaps with an object that is already drawn (found using Region.overlap(Region, Region)) is placed on the 'plane' above that of the current object.

    A click at any Point on a multi-'plane' frame works by processing whether an object was clicked on the 'top' plane using Clickable.isClicked(Point) and if not checking all the planes below.

    Since:
    2018-02-26
    Version:
    1.02.05
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy, Gurdeep_Pol
    See Also:
    Clickable, Point, Region, List
